title: Watson Data Platform Pipeline Connection Schema
description: Connection schema for pipelines in the Watson Data Platform

common_pipeline_connection_def.description: Details of the connection to use for a pipeline binding node.

ref.description: A reference to a connection by ID.

catalog_ref.description: If ref is set, this refers to the ID of the catalog which contains the connection. If neither this attribute nor project_ref are specified, the connection will be assumed to exist in the project or catalog which contains the pipeline.

project_ref.description: If ref is set, this refers to the ID of the project which contains the connection. If neither this attribute nor catalog_ref are specified, the connection will be assumed to exist in the project or catalog which contains the pipeline.

properties.description: The properties for the connection. The specific properties allowed depend on the type of connection referenced.

common_pipeline_data_asset_def.description: Details of the dataset contained in a catalog or project to use for a pipeline binding node.

ref.description: A reference to a dataset by ID.

catalog_ref.description: If ref is set, this refers to the ID of the catalog which contains the dataset. If neither this attribute nor dataset_project_ref are specified, the dataset will be assumed to exist in the project or catalog which contains the pipeline.

project_ref.description: If ref is set, this refers to the ID of the project which contains the dataset. If neither this attribute nor dataset_catalog_ref are specified, the dataset will be assumed to exist in the project or catalog which contains the pipeline.

properties.description: Properties controlling how the dataset is used.

attachment_ref.description: The ID of the dataset attachment to use. If not specified and used as a source, the first suitable attachment found will be used. If not specified and used as a target, a new attachment will be created.

name.description: Specifies the name of the dataset to read, create or update if ref is unset.

no_write_schema.description: When used as a target, whether to update the dataset with the schema when a run completes or not (will be automatically updated if not supplied by caller).

no_write_status.description: When used as a target, whether to update the dataset with the status when a run completes or not (will be automatically updated if not supplied by caller).
